message.content:
Below is a complete breakdown of what is shown in the main (target) image and how it maps onto the block‐dictionary indices, followed by a step‐by‐step build order.  There are two separate “towers” in the target image:

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
1) LEFT‐HAND TOWER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Total Blocks: 7  
• Layer‐by‐Layer Description:  
  – Bottom Layer:  
    1× Yellow rectangular block (dictionary #9) laid horizontally.  
  – Second Layer:  
    2× Orange cylinders (dictionary #10, used twice) standing vertically on top of the yellow block.  
  – Third Layer:  
    1× Yellow rectangular block (dictionary #9) laid across (bridging) the two cylinders.  
    1× Red arch block (dictionary #1) centered on top (the arch opening faces left‐to‐right).  
  – Top (Roof):  
    2× Orange wedge blocks (dictionary #13 and #14) forming the peaked roof.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
2) RIGHT‐HAND TOWER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• Total Blocks: 8  
• Layer‐by‐Layer Description:
  – Bottom Layer:  
    2× Red arches (dictionary #3 on the left, #4 on the right) with their arches running front‐to‐back.  
  – Second Layer:  
    1× Yellow rectangular block (dictionary #9) laid horizontally, bridging across the two red arches.  
  – Third Layer:  
    1× Green cube (dictionary #6) on the left.  
    1× Red arch block (dictionary #1) in the middle (arch opening left‐to‐right).  
    1× Blue cube (dictionary #5) on the right.  
    (All three sit on the same level above the yellow plank.)  
  – Top (Roof):  
    2× Orange wedge blocks (dictionary #13 and #14) forming the peaked roof.

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
BLOCK INDICES NEEDED
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
• #1  (Red arch), used 2 times total (once in each tower)  
• #3  (Red arch), used once (bottom left of right tower)  
• #4  (Red arch), used once (bottom right of right tower)  
• #5  (Blue cube), used once  
• #6  (Green cube), used once  
• #9  (Yellow rectangular plank), used 3 times total (2 in the left tower, 1 in the right)  
• #10 (Orange cylinder), used 2 times (both in the left tower)  
• #13 (Orange wedge), used 2 pairs total (2 wedges per tower, 4 total)  
• #14 (Orange wedge), used 2 pairs total (2 wedges per tower, 4 total)

────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
ASSEMBLY ORDER
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
{
  Step1:  Move block with index 9    // Left tower bottom  
  Step2:  Move block with index 10   // 1st cylinder on left tower  
  Step3:  Move block with index 10   // 2nd cylinder on left tower  
  Step4:  Move block with index 9    // Yellow plank bridging cylinders  
  Step5:  Move block with index 1    // Red arch on top of left tower  
  Step6:  Move block with index 13   // Left tower roof wedge (left side)  
  Step7:  Move block with index 14   // Left tower roof wedge (right side)

  Step8:  Move block with index 3    // Bottom left arch on right tower  
  Step9:  Move block with index 4    // Bottom right arch on right tower  
  Step10: Move block with index 9    // Yellow plank bridging the two red arches  
  Step11: Move block with index 6    // Green cube (right tower, left side)  
  Step12: Move block with index 1    // Red arch spanning between green & blue positions  
  Step13: Move block with index 5    // Blue cube (right tower, right side)  
  Step14: Move block with index 13   // Right tower roof wedge (left side)  
  Step15: Move block with index 14   // Right tower roof wedge (right side)
}

Above instructions ensure the correct shapes, colors, and orientations are used exactly as shown in the dictionary, without any additional rotation.
